meanings.definition: The act of constructing or shaping something.
meanings.sent1: The framing of the house took several weeks to complete.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully planned the framing of her painting.
meanings.sent3: The framing of the cake with colorful icing made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The framing of the argument highlighted the main points effectively.
meanings.sent5: The framing of the garden gate was beautifully crafted and added charm to the entrance.

meanings.definition: The structure or framework that supports or encloses something.
meanings.sent1: The strong framing of the building ensured its stability during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The metal framing of the greenhouse was durable and long-lasting.
meanings.sent3: The framing of the tent collapsed comically during the camping trip.
meanings.sent4: The framing of the bridge stood out against the backdrop of the river.
meanings.sent5: The wooden framing of the window added a rustic touch to the room.

meanings.definition: The way in which something is presented or perceived.
meanings.sent1: The framing of the photograph captured the essence of the moment.
meanings.sent2: The framing of the news story influenced public opinion.
meanings.sent3: The framing of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The framing of the movie scene created a sense of suspense.
meanings.sent5: The framing of the question led to a thoughtful discussion among the group.
